intro: Oreodaphne californica, commonly known as the California tamarack, is a small evergreen shrub native to the coastal regions of California. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes laurels and cinnamon trees. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are elliptical in shape and often have a leathery texture. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers followed by spherical, woody fruits containing aromatic seeds. Oreodaphne californica is adapted to coastal climates and is often found in sandy or rocky soils along the Pacific coast.
